query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

result.title: Report and article manuscript on lessons learned for the Global Stocktake
result.description: This deliverable will combine practical lessons from the implementation of the sectoral conversations, insights on the process and design as well as an ex-post assessment of the first iteration of the Global Stocktake scheduled for 2023 and derive recommendations for the implementation of subsequent stocktaking exercises. The Deliverable will include an article manuscript for submission in a peer-reviewed journal

result.title: Report and analysis on the screening and benchmarking analysis
result.description: Benchmarking of existing advanced foresight frameworks and approaches in civil security domain which will compare existing initiatives with “scoping review” gathering current recommendations and best practices regarding the nature of the methodology and the capabilities that form the building blocks for a Foresight. The analysis and report will focus on two main fundamental attributes of Foresight: the nature of the methodology (qualitative, quantitative or semiquantitative research methods) and the capabilities (ability to gather or process information based on evidence, expertise, interaction or creativity).

project.title: TowArd sustainable foresigHt capabilitiEs for increAseD Civil Security

result.title: Report and academic article manuscripts on options for international cooperation on fossil fuel supply from an interdisciplinary perspective
result.description: This deliverable will compile two article manuscripts on options for international cooperation on fossil fuel subsidy reform. One manuscript will address qualitative policy aspects (responsibility: UEF) and one will provide a quantitative assessment (responsibility: E3M). The deliverable is targeted towards an academic audience. Each manuscript will be submitted for peer review in an appropriate academic journal.

result.title: Innovation Management Plan
result.description: This plan will include at an initial stage a precise and schematic description of the relevant tools / results established in previous projects (i.e. RESCCUE, CLARITY….) and how the project will make use of them and will innovate with respect to them. This is one of the results of task T6.2

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

result.description: Preliminary draft of an integrated work plan aiming to i) disseminate the innovative technologies tested and validated during the project, ii) upscale their application, iii) commercially exploit these technologies, and iv) communicate all findings and products, obtained from the project to stakeholders and a wide public of professionals, consumers and society.

result.title: Report on biosafety data requirements
result.description: "Deliverable 1.1 ""Report on biosafety data requirements"" is a compliance report based on the EU Directive 2001/18 and National Competent Authority requirements for biosafety that will report the risk assessment of 1) GM microalgae based on the QPS (Qualified Presumption of Safety) pipeline, leading to an EFSA risk evaluation; 2) PVY-resistant starch potato following available Competent Authority and EFSA Guidelines. PVY-resistant starch potato. Linked to Task T1.2: Data requirements for biosafety assessment of starch-enhanced, PVY-resistant potatoes and MAA-enhanced microalgae for biobased products under the five governance options"

result.title: Initial Communication and Engagement Plan
result.description: "Deliverable 4.1 ""Initial Communication and Engagement Plan"" provides the strategy, communication and engagement guidelines with a set of tools and materials to ensure effective communication and a unique project visual identity. Delivered in M6. The deliverable will include the design and use guidelines of: i) website; ii) social media accounts on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram and YouTube to cover scientific, policy, business and civil society domains and their stakeholder groups’ reach; iii) press releases, advertorials and web banners in various languages and hosted on news websites to promote the key messages and achievements of the project, raise public awareness about the related issues and increase engagement.It will receive input from Task T4.1. Linked to Task T4.2: Participatory approaches to communication, dissemination & stakeholder engagement."

result.title: Report on upscaling of WT microalgae strain
result.description: "Deliverable 3.1 ""Report on the upscaling of WT Microalgae strain"" will report 1) the case study upscaling results of the WT strain used for developing NGTs, 2) the parameters, 3) adaptations needed when changing to an NGT strain for upscaling. D3.1 is supported by Task T3.4: Cultivation and upscaled production of microalgae."

result.title: Preliminary toolbox for gene editing
result.description: "Deliverable 2.1 ""Preliminary toolbox for gene editing in plants and microalgae"" is a report describing the up-to-date genome editing toolbox for efficient plant breeding in potato and strain optimalisation in microalgae. The toolbox will comprise state-of-the-art CRISPR/Cas9 based constructs, versatile cloning strategies, optimized DNA delivery and regeneration systems, and bioinformatics methods for the integrated design of guide taking guide efficiency into account as well as knowledge on gene family members. The overall toolbox must permit high precision of editing and minimize unwanted alteration of the edited genomes and to develop edited potato and microalgae. Linked to Task T2.1: Constructing a plant and microalgae gene editing toolbox."
